DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior mTOR Inhibitor Combined With Cytotoxic Chemotherapy Administered Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not applicable indicator related to a person who receives medical attention is given medications taken previously with the joint of  any agents that inhibit mTOR (FK506 binding protein 12-rapamycin associated protein 1), one of the protein kinases mediate cellular responses to stresses and an anticancer drugs that kill cancer cells.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior mTOR Inhibitor Combined With Cytotoxic Chemotherapy Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention is given medications taken previously with the joint of  any agents that inhibit mTOR (FK506 binding protein 12-rapamycin associated protein 1), one of the protein kinases mediate cellular responses to stresses and an anticancer drugs that kill cancer cells.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior Medication Usage mTOR Inhibitor Combined With Cytotoxic Chemotherapy Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: An indication or description that medications were taken previously.:Any agents that inhibit mTOR (FK506 binding protein 12-rapamycin associated protein 1), one of the protein kinases mediate cellular responses to stresses such as DNA damage and nutrient deprivation. mTOR acts as the target for the cell-cycle arrest and immunosuppressive effects of the FKBP12-rapamycin complex.:Made or joined or united into one or involving the joint activity of two or more.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:Anticancer drugs that kill cells, especially cancer cells.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: An indication or description that medications were taken previously.

Any substance that inhibits mammalian target of rapamycin (mTOR or FK506 binding protein 12-rapamycin associated protein 1 (FRAP1)), a serine/threonine protein kinase that is active in the control of cell growth, cell proliferation, and cell motility. Inhibition of mTOR can inhibit cell proliferation.
Made or joined or united into one or involving the joint activity of two or more.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
A drug therapy that is used to destroy cancer cells.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient had prior the
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had prior therapy with PI3K inhibitors, AKT inhibitors and/or mTor inhibitors (e.g. everolimus, temsirolimus) or prior therapy with MEK inhibitors (e.g. AZD6244 or selumetinib)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC Question Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had prior therapy with PI3K inhibitors, AKT inhibitors and/or mTor inhibitors?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had prior therapy with any P13K/AKT/mTor pathway inhibitor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior PI3K-AKT-mTOR pathway inhibitor therapy?
